The bar also has a few good TV sets and would be a great place to go to watch a major TV program or sports game with a crowd. I'm thinking of coming back here to watch the presidential debates - because this is the sort of place that can take care of all of your needs without the expensive price tag you might encounter at a fancier bar trying to be all things to all sorts of people. I like Hyde Out best because it's just trying to do one thing really well such as create the perfect spot for a someone to go and grab a drink. 

One last thing: You do need to remember to bring cash
author: Laura G.

description:
The Hyde Out has some cool seating, especially upstairs. The upstairs part has floor-to-ceiling windows. Other people on here are saying it has a great view...I guess it's okay. Nothing really to look at except people and CALA's grocery store (which brings the neighborhood down a notch.) Good place to sit if you want to people watch. 

Other people on here have said that the bartender is super nice. We had a women bartender and she was just okay. Nothing special. She didn't smile or anything when one of us mentioned how hot it was today. 

The beer selection is, again, just okay. Didn't see any Belgians (not counting Stella) or anything super interesting. But then again, I'm used to going to beer bars and, of course, this isn't a beer bar. 

My girlfriend got a vodka tonic and it was a huge and strong vodka tonic. This may be a good starter place. It was Friday though and there were just a handful of locals.
author: Matt S.

description: This place is 4 stars if you get a table on the 2nd floor by the window. Otherwise, it would probably be a 2.75. Good music, good beer -- over 20 on tap, and pitchers available. Definitely a good neighborhood spot for a couple down in ones.
author: Defne A.

description: This place is right up my alley as far as dive bars are concerned. They give out free hot dogs, have good beers on tap, friendly bartenders, games to be played, and interesting people (and dogs) going in and out. My friend and I have been on a search for a good dive bar, and while we were sitting there, we knew we had found our second home. Plus, it is conveniently located halfway between our apartments. Whats not to love about the Hydeout?
author: Caitlin D.

description: YES - thank god - a laid back place to get a drink on a friday night and maybe watch some TV - people seem like regulars (one was reading a book at the bar) - no screaming drunk girls, good jukebox - it is so nice to sit on the second floor and look out onto california street and the intersection - no idea why this is labeled as a dive bar, i guess it can be considered divey for nob hill?
author: Lisa M.

description: This is a great place to relax and have a cocktail or five. I used to frequent it more often when I worked in the city but it is still a nice place to just chill with a Fernet and beer. The seating upstairs is nice for a group but usually I prefer to just sit at the bar. Don't go here expecting to much in the way of a social scene but depending on the mood your in that can be a good thing.
author: John M.

description: Pretty awesome smaller, dark and neon, with an older crowd that loves to watch sports on the flat screen TVs(any sport depending on the season).  My favorite place is the upstairs which is a great vantage point to watch folks walk about California, in and out of Cala Foods, and getting off and on the Trolly Cars.  Decently priced beers and cocktails, but the jukebox is kind of a rip off even though the song selection is huge.  Also, it's right next to Golden Horse Chinese food, which, in my opinion, is some of the best Chinese food I've had in a long time.  Good grub after you fill yourself full of booze.
author: Veronica S.

description: I kind of feel like it's not a good thing when they know your name at a bar because you frequent it so often. But oh well. I stop by here after I get off work late at night probably way more than is necessary. The bartender is the sweetest, she knows exactly I want every time, sometimes even better than I do. "Looks like a hard night, girl. A shot for you." Who am I to deny a shot, even if it comes on the pretense that I look ridiculously tired/like crap. Anyway, thankfully no one thinks its weird that I like to come and drink by myself....but I never end the night by myself (no, not like that). I've met some really awesome people here, everyone wants to strike up a conversation, and there's a general laid-back and friendly vibe.. Cash only, remember that. Bring your drink upstairs and look out over California street, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jenna W.

description: Not much more that I can really add that hasn't been said before but I'll re-emphasize that this place rocks.  Though some might consider it a dive bar, it's definitely on the upper echelon as opposed to dive bars in the Mission.  Perhaps it's cuz it's in Nob Hill . . . Anyhow, the HydeOut is a great place to come in, grab a beer/cocktail, and chill.  On a Friday or Saturday night, it might get a little louder and rowdier but it's still pretty low key.  The new jukebox also lets you find some random tunes to rock out to.  The bartenders are some good-looking ladies and provide great service.  Soon enough, even if you don't come in all that often, they'll know you by name and drink.  Drinks are moderately priced and made stiff.  Only thing to this place is it is CASH ONLY, with of course the conveniently placed ATM inside in case you need more moola.
author: George J.

description: This is a non-sceney place to spend a sunny afternoon. Sit in the upstairs area and spend endless entertaining hours watching really bad drivers have near-misses with pedestrians and cable car riders at the intersection of California and Hyde. With the free wi-fi they provide, you can blog about it while enjoying your beer.
author: Michelle J.

description:
so the bf took me here.. me a native, and him not at all...  said he did a job around the area..  was so sure we've been there before.. i told his ass to get his girls straight.  he said it must've been his 'co-woker' he was with.  sure.  way to make a girl feel special. 

anyways...  so he ordered a bloody mary, and i had scotch.  i like the little treats that come w/bloody mary's and was picking off his... this is where i noticed that there were green bumps on his pickled asparagus.  i mean the bumps were textured and shit.  we told the bartender, who you could tell has been here in the US for a while but definitely not a native, and she looked at the jar from where it came from and told us they all looked like that.  then she proceeded to tell the men sitting at the bar that they all looked like that, and that it was a new bottle just opened so it should be fine. trying to get their opinions to back her up.  those drunk ass fools didn't know a damn mold if they saw one...  they were there on a random monday hammered out of their mind and it was mid afternoon.  needless to say, the bf just put the asparagus off to the side.

i like the  bar though.  it's a cool dive.  haven't been there at night.. i'm sure it gets packed.  not too much room in there either.  i like the upstairs.. you can grab a table and look out onto the street.
author: Sheri N.

description: The Hyde Out is my favorite bar in my neighborhood. The name is perfectly descriptive: it's a quiet oasis in a relatively crowded and noisy scene *cough* Hemlock Tavern *cough*. Come here to get an inexpensive drink served up by the sweet bartender, pick out a song on the jukebox and head upstairs to chat away an evening while taking in the view -- usually some guy sitting in front of Cala Foods trying to eat his shoe, or something, but it's much better than trying to drink while crammed into some hipster's armpit.
author: Kate R.

description:
questionable.  i was expecting it to be a lot more fun.  it's smaller then it looks from the outside.  the bartender was friendly.  but i wouldn't put this on my list of bars to frequent.  

CASH ONLY.  negative points.
author: jessie h.

description: Very unpretentious and typical dive bar. Juke box is surprisingly good. Grab a table upstairs and watch the people, cars and trolleys narrowly miss each other. With a beer or drink in one hand, what more could you ask for?
author: The Sock S.

description: I love this place. There are always old men at the bar, which is awesome when you just wanna hang with the girls. I've never gone in and not had a great time hanging out with the regulars and the bartenders. There are usually enough young people to at least feel like you can chat with someone born in the same decade, but it's not a huge sleaze fest. My favorite thing is that you can stay downstairs with all the regs and the bartender, or you can head upstairs for a more open space when you're with a group. Both are great.
author: Monika M.

description:
I always have a good time here, during the day or at night.

This is a great all around bar. Cozy and chill enough to hang out after work; lively enough to stay out at on a Friday night; and a central location to meet up at early before heading south or west. It's usually a good mix of friendly locals and people from other neighborhoods looking to hang out and chill or maybe get a little crazy.

The bartenders are good looking, friendly, and make tasty drinks at neighborhood bar prices (try the "Space Pussy"). Again, the bartenders here always fun!

They have an Internet jukebox to play your favorite jams and a huge flat screen TV to watch sports. The building is on a corner, with an upstairs and downstairs filled with windows = great for people watching.

The Polk, Van Ness, and California buses drop off within blocks. It's easy to catch a cab to and from. 

*Don't park in the supermarket lot across the street, they'll tow you.
author: Neb N.

description: This is Nob Hill's best kept secret. We used this bar to get off the scene and just have a nice comfortable drink. The jukebox is not bad either, and is readily available, which makes for a great jukebox war session. Hide upstairs, if you've got a group and would like a little space for dominos, or whatever it is you and your crew like to do. Or you can stay downstairs, and talk to it's neighborhood regs who don't mind friendly conversation.
author: M S.

description: Good bar.  Fun people.  Nice upstairs.
author: The P.

description: cool bar. the loft is a sweet place to sit and drink and people watch--on the street and in the bar. good place to chill with friends without screaming your lungs out.
author: Dean E.

description: This is a great place for a beer, or a pitcher (albeit small ones), which they do have and a lot of different kinds of beer.  The bartenders are nice and accomodating but they don't take credit card.  Supposedly, this is currently being rectified.
author: Brooks O.

description:
i really wanted to like this bar since its around the block from my house and it kills time while im waiting for my laundry, but the hyde out  has one big problem, and one other problem:
did i just pay $4 for a domestic beer? thats pretty unamerican. i dont even get to keep the bottle? thats fine, i guess ill just drink here when i get paid. no big deal . a bar like this is just like any other bar, it has its regulars, and most the time the regulars at any bar seem to be pretty cool, and thats where this place differs. there's a heavy-set slug  that drinks here , and 9 out of 10 times ive been here cant keep her eyes off of me. i stopped by here the other day to grab a quick drink while i was waiting on my food, stepped up to the bar and tried to order a drink, meanwhile,  bertha (thats what i imagine your name to be) comes out of the bathroom, (probably just got done destroying it) comes back and sits down right next to where im standing , and puts her fat hotdog fingered hand on the stool next to her, as if im going to sit there. stop looking at me like a criminal, its not cool, you are this bars "party foul".
author: Greasy w.
